title: Matt Pagett
text:
Research interests

AI and robotics explainability, trustworthiness, and accountability
Digital humanities
World models

title: Matt Pagett
text:
Select projects

Research projects
EMPO - Empowerment-based AI agents (contributing in connection with AI Safety Initiative Groningen)


Hackathons
Adversarial LLM span detection for social sycophancy observation (Entry submitted to Apart Research AI Manipulation Hackathon - Jan 2026)
Comparative LLM methods for social media bot detection (2nd place winner, November 2025 Apart Defensive Acceleration Hackathon)
Protocop - social media moderation toolkit using MCP (Entered into MCP 1st Anniversary Hackathon, November 2025)


Digital humanities
Cervantes Reader (v1) - AI-powered narration/analysis for early modern literature
Artificial Quartet. An early attempt to use generative AI to write a play. Submitted as an entry to the Financial Times 2020 Weekend Festival theater contest.

title: Matt Pagett
text:
Resources

AI Safety
BlueDot provides education about AI safety and governance. I completed the AGI Strategy and Technical AI Safety courses in 2025 and recommend them to anyone interested in AI risk.
ARENA - detailed technical AI safety course. Iâ€™ve formed a self-study group on the ARENA Slack channel.


Software Development
SolveIt is a course, a method, and a platform to use LLMs thoughtfully in software development (and other areas, like writing). It is led by Jeremy Howard whose Fast.AI course on Deep Learning remains as relevant and useful as when I first took it in 2019.
